profileText: (Nephew of Abraham Yates), a Delegate from New York; born in Albany, N.Y., August 23, 1747; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Albany; member of the committee on correspondence in 1775; resigned and was reelected, but declined to serve; regent of the University of the State of New York in 1784; served in the State assembly in 1784 and 1785; Member of the Continental Congress in 1786; resumed the practice of law; died in Caughnawaga, N.Y., March 9, 1826.

researchRecord.name: 1786, 2 pages.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Peter Waldron Yates to Gerard Bancker written on May 24, 1786. In the letter, Peter Yates discusses some monetary manners in which state owes him money. He also discusses the upcoming elections. He states "Mr. Yates has a majority of 300 votes for senator and the little general is not a little mortified." He also discusses the assembly election and states he believes John Livingston of Stilwater is to be elected from the Albany district.
